revised_title: Exploring the Lattice Structure and Ligand Binding in Low Salt T-State Haemoglobin Crystals
tldr: Researchers studied the lattice structure of low salt T-state haemoglobin crystals and found that the stability of the lattice allows the haemoglobin molecule to bind ligands without the crystal breaking up. The structure of the low salt T-state crystals is maintained by a few well-defined salt bridges and hydrogen bonds, which prevent the larger quaternary movements associated with oxygenation. This stability enables the researchers to study ligand binding and the structural basis of the T-state's low affinity for oxygen directly through X-ray diffraction.
